name: brfvid
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, wff w0
body: |- wi(w0, wb(wbr(c0, cfv(cid, c1), c2), wbr(c0, c1, c2)))

stmt.origin: breqd(c0, cfv(cid, c1), c2, c1, w0)

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wb(wbr(c0, cfv(cid, c1), c2), wbr(c0, c1, c2)))
-| wi(w0, wceq(cfv(cid, c1), c1))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wb(wbr(c0, cfv(cid, c1), c2), wbr(c0, c1, c2)))
-| wi(w0, wceq(cfv(cid, c1), c1))

stmt.origin: syl(w0, wceq(cfv(cid, c1), c1), wcel(c1, universe))

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wceq(cfv(cid, c1), c1))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c1, universe))
-| wi(wcel(c1, universe), wceq(cfv(cid, c1), c1))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wb(wbr(c0, cfv(cid, c1), c2), wbr(c0, c1, c2)))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c1, universe))
-| wi(wcel(c1, universe), wceq(cfv(cid, c1), c1))

|- wi(w0, wb(wbr(c0, cfv(cid, c1), c2), wbr(c0, c1, c2)))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c1, universe))

comment: If two elements are connected by a value of the identity relation, then they are connected via the argument. (Contributed by RP, 21-Jul-2020.)
